Class EnvironmentPanel

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, IPanel, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class EnvironmentPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements IPanel

A panel which contains a scrollable table with the environment information.

Method Detail

dispose

public void dispose()
Description copied from interface: IPanel
Should clean up used resources when the panel is shut down.

This method is also declared in IModule (IModule.dispose()). This makes it easy to write a graphical module that implements both, IModule and IPanel. See these weird explanations.

Specified by:
dispose in interface IPanel
See Also:
IModule.dispose()

getIcon

public javax.swing.Icon getIcon()
Description copied from interface: IPanel
Returns the panel's icon. If the panel should have no icon, this method must return null.

Specified by:
getIcon in interface IPanel
Returns:
The panel's icon or null.
See Also:
ImageIcon

getPanelInstance

public java.awt.Component getPanelInstance()
Description copied from interface: IPanel
Returns a reference to the module instance's GUI part as Component. Each invokation of getPanelInstance must return a reference to the same object. This means that this method must not create a new panel but return just a reference to a once created panel.

If the implementing module class extends java.awt.Component (e.g. if it extends javax.swing.JPanel) this method simply might return this.

Specified by:
getPanelInstance in interface IPanel
Returns:
The concrete GUI-part as java.awt.Component.

getTitle

public java.lang.String getTitle()
Description copied from interface: IPanel
Returns the panel's title. The title is to be used in the tabbar.

Specified by:
getTitle in interface IPanel
Returns:
The title.
